intro: Alepidocalyx parvulus, commonly known as the small-flowered alepidocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth surface, while the stems are hairy and woody. Alepidocalyx parvulus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
